conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric render: walls have vertical height and thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, interior volume is readable, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion with thickness; floors read as distinct planes; good corner geometry and cutaway visibility. Minor simplifications/soft edges in some partitions reduce geometric crispness.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall zoning matches (living/dining center, kitchen near center, bedrooms on ends), and most partitions appear present. However, exterior elements (deck/balconies) and some toilet/utility/lobby proportions and exact wall runs look simplified relative to the 2D plan, and openings are not reliably verifiable.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, dining table, sofa area) and basic kitchen blocks included. Bathrooms/fixtures are present but simplified and not all rooms show clear fixture layouts consistent with the labeled 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with readable walls/floors and good visibility. Limited window/door detailing reduces structural readability of openings; otherwise coherent materials and no major mesh artifacts.

detected_errors.description: Some layout/proportion drift vs. 2D plan, especially around exterior deck/balconies and certain service/toilet partition sizes.
Doors/windows/openings are simplified; exact placement/orientation relative to the 2D plan cannot be confirmed for several rooms.
Bathroom/utility furnishing and fixture detail is simplified and not consistently identifiable room-by-room.

summary: A clear, valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong 3D fundamentals and broadly faithful room zoning, but with noticeable simplification and proportion drift in exterior/service areas and limited opening fidelity.
